name: Indian Law Enforcement
objective: To provide funds to Indian Tribal Governments to operate police departments and detention facilities.

results.description: Indian Affairs fulfilled its mission by issuing approximately 300 awards in FY2020
Indian Affairs issued 170 new awards and modifications to existing awards to 135 recipients.
Awards 66 grants to entities to complete the goals and objectives of the program.
This  award funded 179 programs to assist the tribe's law enforcement services, the administration of adult and juvenile corrections programs.

authorizations.text: Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act, Public Law 93-638, as amended, 25 U.S.C. 450 et seq.; Indian Law Enforcement Reform Act, Public Law 101-379, 25 U.S.C. 2801.

rules_regulations: 25 CFR Part 900;  2 CFR 200 Uniform Administrative Requirements, Cost Principles, and Audit Requirements for Federal Awards; 25 CFR Parts 10, 11 and 12; Indian Affairs Manual, Chapter 40, "Law Enforcement and Detention;" and Detention and Law Enforcement Handbooks.
